text:
58 year old Portugese speaking male admitted to MICU for stent
   placement [**2-15**] TBM with PMH OSA, afib with RVR, DM, HTN, ARF now CRI
   thought initial insult d/t NSIAD use, (had HD x1 at [**Hospital3 2241**], none
   since), baseline creatinine 2.5. Pt initially at [**Hospital1 959**] admitted for
   paresthesias, back/sciatic nerve pain; intubated for airway protection
   d/t altered mental status, trached/PEG after failure to wean with #7
   Portex, chronic vent, also with persistent FUO and treated with
   multiple abx, recurrent diarrhea, work-up negative, able to eventually
   wean to PS; transferred to [**Hospital 25**] rehab where he has been for 1
   month, while at [**Name (NI) 25**], pt with persistent diarrhea, so TF stopped,
   then sent to CHA with fevers and hypotension; sent to CHA with
   urosepsis, treated with vanco/zosyn, then only zosyn, found TBM on CT;
   prior to transfer pt went into rapid afib, was treated with adenosine,
   converted to flutter, rec
d dilt and lopressor IV, then started on dilt
   gtt, weaned off to PO dilt. Transfer to MICU for mgt chronically vented
   pt and planned for trach stent placement. Of note, patient
s PEG is now
   a 16fr foley catheter in abd, unable to confirm correct placement by
   CXR, thus may not be safe to use; am PO dilt held, given 1x IV dose
   instead.
   Events- cont on heparin for right ij thrombus at 1950u/hr ptt
   therapeutic at 60.4. needs repeat ptt at [**2159**].
   Hypernatremia (high sodium)
   Assessment:
   Na down to 144 this am.
   Action:
   Free h20 boluses decreased to 100cc q 6 hours.
   Response:
   Repeat na at 1500 144.
   Plan:
   Recheck na in am.  Cont free h20 boluses as ordered.
   Fever, unknown origin (FUO, Hyperthermia, Pyrexia)
   Assessment:
   Temp up to 100.1 max.
   Action:
   Cont on ceftriaxone for uti.
   Response:
   Low grade temps.
   Plan:
   Cont to check results of cult done yesterday.
   Atrial fibrillation (Afib)
   Assessment:
   This am hr in the 130
s afib with occasional pvc.
   Action:
   Night nurse had given 10mg iv dilt at 0700. on dilt 60mg per g tube
   qid.
   Response:
   Hr down to low 100
s and back in nsr with occasional pac
s and rare
   pvc.
   Plan:
   Cont on dilt 60mg qid.
   Altered mental status (not Delirium)
   Assessment:
   More alert today per micu team. When team in he was mouthing words in
   what appeared to be an appropriate manner. Mae. Pearl sluggish
   response. At times does not obey commands.
   Action:
   No meds required for agitation.
   Response:
   Mental status appears to be improved.
   Plan:
   Cont to monitor mental status.
   Respiratory failure, chronic
   Assessment:
   This am on vent 50% fio2 peep of 5 and ps of 10. bs rhonchorous.
   Suctioned for thick yellow sputum this am. In small amounts. Sats
   88-100%.
   Action:
   Weaning to trach collar today.
   Response:
   Weaned to trach collat 50%. Resp in the 20
s sats 98% or greater.
   Plan:
   TC as tolerated.
   Social- family in to visit. Updated on plan of care.
   ------ Protected Section [**Hospital 948**]
   [**Hospital 2437**] hospital microlab called to let us know that he grew MRSA in
   his sputum.
   ------ Protected Section Addendum Entered By:[**Name (NI) **] [**Last Name (NamePattern1) 3200**] [**Name8 (MD) 142**], RN
   on:[**2168-8-7**] 16:50 ------
